title: User panel UI styling + mobile-fit dashboard adjustments

requirements.summary: Make the logged-in username in the User Dashboard header visually prominent with larger sizing and a designer-chosen color/gradient while still showing the numeric user ID.
acceptanceCriteria: On the user dashboard header, the user name is noticeably larger than before and uses a clear colored/gradient styling (not plain white-only).
The header still shows both “User: <id>” and the user name.
No layout overlap occurs in the header at common mobile widths (e.g., 360px).

file_operations.description: Update the fixed header typography/layout to highlight the username (larger font, gradient/colored text treatment instead of plain white), keep “User: <id>” visible, and add overflow-safe behavior (wrapping/truncation) so the header does not overlap at ~360px widths.

Add/adjust a small reusable utility class for gradient text (e.g., background-clip text + text-transparent pattern) to support consistent username styling in the dashboard header without changing application copy.

requirements.summary: Reduce dashboard tile and clock card sizing so notice/clock/KPIs/2x2 tiles fit within common mobile viewports without tiles overflowing off-screen.
acceptanceCriteria: At a typical mobile viewport (e.g., 360x800), the dashboard shows the notice (if enabled), clock, KPI summary, and the 2x2 tile grid without tiles rendering outside the frame/container.
The tile grid remains fully visible within the dashboard frame without horizontal overflow.
The clock card is slightly reduced in height/typography compared to current, while remaining readable.
No new scrolling/overlap regressions are introduced with the fixed header and fixed footer present.

file_operations.description: Adjust the 'user' (and/or 'small') size variant to be more compact on mobile by reducing padding, icon size, and label typography; also tweak sizing constraints (e.g., aspect/spacing) to prevent overflow while keeping tiles readable.
Reduce clock card visual footprint (padding, border thickness, time/date font sizes, and overall vertical spacing) while preserving readability to help the dashboard fit on common mobile screens.

Tune the dashboard layout spacing (content padding, section margins, grid gap, and tile size prop selection) to ensure the 2x2 tile grid stays fully within the viewport/frame without horizontal overflow and with fixed header/footer present.
Slightly compact KPI card spacing/typography (without changing labels/content) to support the overall goal of fitting notice + clock + KPIs + tiles on typical mobile viewports.

requirements.summary: Apply a cohesive, attractive color theme to the registration form (RegisterView) while keeping all behaviors unchanged.
acceptanceCriteria: The registration screen uses a cohesive, visually distinct color theme (background + card + inputs + button) rather than mostly neutral/unstyled colors.
Text remains readable with sufficient contrast in both light conditions and on mobile.
Form behavior (validation, pending request storage, success messaging, switching back to login) remains unchanged.

file_operations.description: Restyle the registration screen with a cohesive theme: enhance page background, card styling, headings, input borders/focus states, and the primary submit button; keep validation logic and submission flow unchanged. Use the shadcn-ui Card/Input/Button components already present for consistent theming. Verify the component's usage instructions before implementing.

Add/adjust any minimal global utility styles needed to support the new RegisterView color theme (e.g., an auth background or input focus glow utility), ensuring readability/contrast on mobile and avoiding changes to backend workflows.
